poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
The fruits of the mulberry Flutes of baroque The flukes of desire That Ahab is trying to harpoon. It's like shooting back at Cupid Stupid
A clonic assembly of Fausts In the founts of banality frowsts And it flouts the convention Of thought and intent. Figures Flouse. And they frounce and they flounce.
